title: When you are the jungler, and every lane begins to fall simultaneously

replies.body: Poor little charmander.... He will run out of water eventually.

Better than having too much wtaer
http://i.imgur.com/os2sho3.gif

The funny part is that the water snuffing his tail's fire results in death!

You know, for kids!

Not necessarily. If I remember correctly, its PokeDex entry says that when it's sick, the flame on the tail will dim.

That means that the flame's size depends on the health of the individual, not the other way around. In other words, if it gets put out by water, the Charmander can probably just restart it instantly.

Yes I'm a Pokemon geek. Shut up.
Back during the first season of Pokemon it was 'If the fire goes out, Charmander dies' A lot of Pokedex entries have changed since that time.

_From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out._

Charmander's entry from Pokemon Y.

I much prefer indicator of health regardless of "Official canon" because you know...having a charmander get REALLY Annoyed if their tail is doused in water and have it relight it's own tail using it's breath...is pretty funny.

_From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out._

Charmander's entry from Pokemon Y.

> [{quoted}](name=VorpalWarlord,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=2agfqH0J,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2015-08-03T19:43:02.371+0000)
>
> Not necessarily. If I remember correctly, its PokeDex entry says that when it's sick, the flame on the tail will dim.
> 
> That means that the flame's size depends on the health of the individual, not the other way around. In other words, if it gets put out by water, the Charmander can probably just restart it instantly.
> 
> Yes I'm a Pokemon geek. Shut up.

not sure but wasn't there an episode where they had to keep charmanders tail lit or he'd actually die? or maybe it was charizard? or both?

Pokemon has always been a little grim.
Pokemon Yellow	-Wears the skull of its deceased mother. Its cries echo inside the skull and come out as a sad melody.
Don't forget about them harvesting slowpoke tails.....
Along with driftbloom (I think) kidnapping children.
I like how that GIF is almost perfectly looped.
Its not perfectly looped? When is the loop end, I can't tell.
I hope the jungler doesn't get "flamed" after that. :p
AHA HA HA hem...
It's Charmander's fault for not having two watering cans.

"But But But, the jungler is suppose to win my lane for me, so that I can take all the credit and feel like I am the carry" -Many Many people I have met while jungling myself or seeing junglers getting blamed for things they had nothing to do with

Some of my games got to the point where people expect Master Yi (or any other hard carry) jungle needs to get a Gp5 item and rely solely on assists to get gold, leaving the jungle completely open for the enemy to get Poacher's Knife and take it all away.
and you realise you can't be everywhere (your teammate never understand that, its always the jgler fault D: )
I always count on my jungler never showing up and the enemy jungler showing up every ~2mins. Tahm Kench for life waka waka waka waka.

> [{quoted}](name=551202,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=2agfqH0J,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-08-03T03:16:32.754+0000)
>
> and you realise you can't be everywhere (your teammate never understand that, its always the jgler fault D: )

{{champion:4}} not so fast my friend {{champion:80}} {{champion:98}}
I have more than one game where all of my lanes died 5 times before I hit level 6.

when this happens, I can't help but feel sorry for the jungler. Every lane is going down, this guy is running around trying to save each lane. This keeps him from being able to farming his jungle, all while the enemy jungle is likely stealing blue and red, leaving the little monsters so the buffs don't respawn. Junglers have it rough :L

If the poor guy is running around trying to save each lane, he's doing it wrong.
Can't really blame him, tend to do that mistake my self, but the best you can do in that situation is focus on the lane with the highest snowball/roam potential and ignore the rest, so you eventually get a second guy that can help saveing the rest while you don't fall to far behind your self.
Running around trying to save each lane usually ends with you getting underfarmed, underleveled and often enough killed.
sadly most players, especially laners, don't realise that and blame the jungler for all the bad things in the world

And you have not even finish your first 3 camps, and the score is already 0/4.

Good times.

I feel you.  Sometimes though if the other jungle is putting out tons of pressure it becomes very hard to farm your lane, which case everyone starts falling behind.  Then out of desperation they might farm out past their wards and get ganked.
rofl you are complaining when your team actually wards. in my hometown that's a godsend

Such an accurate gif. Match starts, you haven't even gotten to your 2nd buff camp yet and already bot lane has fed a double kill and mid and top are either dead or bitching for help. Gave the jungle up in s3, not going back.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eFTLKWw542g
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UfipAgNRDx0
I've had games were I get spam pinged to come gank before I've even started my third camp. Moment later they give up a double kill and start flaming me for not ganking at the 3 minute mark.
I had that happen once. While I was playing Amumu.
I was playing Diana.  You know how great those level 2 Diana ganks are!.....

You gotta wait for the Level 3-4 Blue Buff timing. Saw that in a video recently.

lol
Happened to me as well. I was playing Elise. Not even level 3 yet.

Then you get raged at by a Yasuo that lost lane to a tank Katarina without Kat getting ganks [and in the top lane].
(Can somebody explain that to me O_O?)
kat can do as much damage with ult only building a couple damage items as a wukong can do with full ad on his ult

and then all you see is  "shitty jungler fucking feg he's only gotten the last 2 dragons.

It honestly pisses me off if all lanes start to crumble, i'm trying to stack my devourer, keep track of drag, and gank all at the same time and be yelled at xD

My worst ever jungle game, as jungle Shyv before Sated Devourer came out:
-Bot losing horribly to Varus/Thresh
-Mid losing to one of the assassins, I think it was LB
-Top losing to Nasus

Yeah it was three ungankable lanes for Shyv so all I could do was clear the jungle while their Lee ganked every 30 seconds.  Even worse, all of my lanes thought it was a good idea to push like hell.
Only time I get annoyed with my jungler is when I can never leave top lane for the first 20 minutes of the game because there has been 0 jungler presence top lane and I've been gamked 5+ times.
Team is flaming :P

I died laughing by seeing this. xD
(Yes, I'm a ghost.)
And then you get blamed for not ganking enough after chain-ganking top, to bot.
What about junglers who try to help and make lanes 100x worse...lee sin ganks top after the top laner told him not to, goes in gets killed by riven and gives her 2x buffs...

Oh god, this is the worst... I was playing {{champion:41}} first time since rework on the Rift before he was disabled and I told my Jungler to ignore my lane twice, once in lobby and after ten minutes. _He proceeded to gank four times and try to gank mid lane once._

Ganking is great, but when a Lane tells you to farm or gank other lanes, **they mean it.**
When you are farming devourer's and every lane loses..
LOL
Then you say fuck them and build devourer.
Moral of the story, it's the jungler's fault for having their back turned :P
